feed.title: Event
feed.subtitle: All items in Space Schedule > Event.

entry.title: US EVA-71
entry.content: NASA astronauts Kathleen Rubins and Victor Glover will exit the orbital lab to prepare the installation of iROSAs (ISS Roll Out Solar Arrays).

entry.title: NG-15 Cygnus Berthing
entry.content: NASA TV will livestream the rendezvous and capture of Northrop Grumman's NG-15 Cygnus cargo craft to the International Space Station.

entry.title: SLS 2nd Hot Fire Test
entry.content:
NASA plans to conduct a second Green Run hot fire test as early as the fourth week in February with the Space Launch System (SLS) rocketâ€™s core stage that will launch the Artemis I mission to the Moon.
The four RS-25 engines will be fired for 8 minutes, demonstrating performance similar to an actual launch.

entry.title: NASA Mars 2020 Perseverance Rover Landing
entry.content:
NASA's Mars 2020 Perseverance rover will land in the Jezero crater using a MSL-inspired sky-crane at approximately 20:55 UTC.
It will investigate an astrobiologically relevant ancient environment on Mars and investigate its surface geological processes and history, including the assessment of its past habitability, the possibility of past life on Mars, and the potential for preservation of biosignatures within accessible geological materials. It will cache sample containers along its route for a potential future Mars sample-return mission.
It will also carry a helicopter drone.

entry.title: Starship SN10 Static Fire
entry.content:
SpaceX will attempt to perform a static fire of the Starship SN10 vehicle.
The date of this event is a NET estimate.

entry.title: Progress MS-16 Docking
entry.content: The Progress MS-16 spacecraft is scheduled to autonomously dock to the Russian Orbital Segment of the ISS.
